adjective.description: Of the jaws of a rotifer: having well-developed, stout mallei.

verb.description: To beat with a hammer; specifically to beat (metal) thin or flat.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Charles Thomas Hudson (1828–1903), naturalist. From malleus + -ate<br>late 16th century. Either from malleat-, past participial stem of post-classical Latin malleare, or independently from classical Latin malleus hammer + -ate, after malleable, malleation.
